fact:
Minecraft pre-Classic rd-131655 (*Cave game tech test*) released on May 13, 2009 only had three blocks: Air (not considered a block at the time), Cobblestone, and Grass.
*Note: the image below is from pre-Classic rd-13**2211**, which added support for placing and breaking blocks.*
From the *Cave game tech test* (May 13, 2009) to *pre-Classic rd-161348* (May 16, 2009), it took about 3 days for Saplings to be added to Minecraft.
From the *Cave game tech test* (May 13, 2009) to *Classic 0.0.3a* (May 16, 2009), it took about 3 days for Caves to be added to Minecraft.

From the *Cave game tech test* (May 13, 2009) to *Classic 0.0.12a* (May 19, 2009), it took about 6 days for Bedrock, Water, and Lava to be added to Minecraft.
*Water and Lava could not drown/deal damage to the player at the time.*

From the *Cave game tech test* (May 13, 2009) to *Classic 0.0.14a* (May 27, 2009), it took about 14 days for Sand, Gravel, Gold Ore, Iron Ore, Coal Ore, Logs, Leaves and Trees to be added to Minecraft.
